articles.author: BASSEM MROUE
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Israel carried out a series of massive airstrikes overnight in southern suburbs of Beirut and another that cut off the main border crossing between Lebanon and Syria, a main crossing point for tens of thousands of people fleeing Israeli bombardment.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes rock southern suburbs of Beirut and cut off a key crossing into Syria

articles.author: LEO CORREA and MELANIE LIDMAN
articles.description: Lilach Almog walks past the remains of a police station seized by Hamas militants and buildings pockmarked by bullets in her southern Israeli town multiple times a day.
articles.title: A year later, Israeli survivors reflect on the lingering toll of Oct. 7

articles.author: JEFF AMY
articles.description: PENSACOLA, N.C. (AP) — The search for victims of Hurricane Helene dragged into its second week on Friday, as exhausted rescue crews and volunteers continued to work long days — navigating past washed out roads, downed power lines and mudslides — to reach the isolated and the missing.
articles.title: As search for Helene's victims drags into second week, sheriff says rescuers 'will not rest'

articles.author: TOM KRISHER
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — The union representing 45,000 striking U.S. dockworkers at East and Gulf coast ports reached a deal Thursday to suspend a three-day strike until Jan. 15 to provide time to negotiate a new contract.
articles.title: Dockworkers' union to suspend strike until Jan. 15 to allow time to negotiate new contract

articles.author: CHRIS MEGERIAN
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris will visit the union stronghold of Flint on Friday as she battles with Donald Trump for working-class voters who could tip the scales in this year's election.
articles.title: Harris and Trump battle for labor support as dockworkers suspend strike

articles.author: LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Days before rioters roamed the halls of the U.S. Capitol threatening to “hang Mike Pence,” Donald Trump told his vice president that people are going to “hate your guts” and “think you're stupid” if he failed to stop the 2020 election certification.
articles.title: Filing in Trump case details remarkable schism with Pence over rejecting 2020 election loss

articles.author: ALAN SUDERMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The future was once dazzling for IronNet.Founded by a former director of the National Security Agency and stacked with elite members of the U.S.
articles.title: Collapse of national security elites' cyber firm leaves bitter wake

articles.author: CLAIRE GALOFARO and KIM TONG-HYUNG
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — Dozens of South Korean adoptees, many in tears, have responded to an investigation led by The Associated Press and documented by Frontline (PBS) last week on Korean adoptions.
articles.title: Did this happen to me also? Korean adoptees question their past and ask how to find their families

articles.author: CHRISTOPHER WEBER and JAIMIE DING
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Prosecutors in Los Angeles are reviewing new evidence in the case of Erik and Lyle Menendez to determine whether they should be serving life sentences for killing their parents in their Beverly Hills mansion more than 35 years ago, the city's district attorney said Thursday.
articles.title: Los Angeles prosecutors to review new evidence in Menendez brothers' 1996 murder conviction

articles.author: ELÉONORE HUGHES and HANNAH-KATHRYN VALLES
articles.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Benny Briolly beamed as she strode through the concrete favela alleyway in a snow-white dress, volunteers proudly waving campaign flags emblazoned with her face.
articles.title: Death threats assail Brazil's trailblazing trans candidates as they campaign
